qas.question: Who has stated that apolitical food problems do not exist?
While natural occurrences can cause famine, what determines the severity of it?

context: The Nobel Prize-winning economist <a0_0>Amartya Sen<a0_0/> has observed that "there is no such thing as an apolitical food problem." While <a1_0>drought<a1_0/> and other naturally occurring events may trigger famine conditions, it is <a2_0>government action or inaction<a2_0/> that determines its severity, and often even whether or not a famine will occur.
